Stats: 18 executed, 0 missed, 2 excluded, 55 ignored

  1. """
  2. Utils for the ``calendarium`` app.
  4. The code of these utils is highly influenced by or taken from the utils of
  5. django-schedule:
  7. https://github.com/thauber/django-schedule/blob/master/schedule/utils.py
  10. """
  11. import time
  12. from django.utils import timezone
  15. def now(**kwargs):
  16. """
  17. Utility function to zero microseconds to avoid inaccuracy.
  19. I replaced the microseconds, because there is some slightly varying
  20. difference that occurs out of unknown reason. Since we probably never
  21. schedule events on microsecond basis, seconds and microseconds will be
  22. zeroed everywhere.
  24. """
  25. return timezone.now(**kwargs).replace(second=0, microsecond=0)
  28. def monday_of_week(year, week):
  29. """
  30. Returns a datetime for the monday of the given week of the given year.
  32. """
  33. str_time = time.strptime('{0} {1} 1'.format(year, week), '%Y %W %w')
  34. date = timezone.datetime(year=str_time.tm_year, month=str_time.tm_mon,
  35. day=str_time.tm_mday, tzinfo=timezone.utc)
  36. if timezone.datetime(year, 1, 4).isoweekday() > 4:
  37. # ISO 8601 where week 1 is the first week that has at least 4 days in
  38. # the current year
  39. date -= timezone.timedelta(days=7)
  40. return date
  43. class OccurrenceReplacer(object):
  44. """
  45. When getting a list of occurrences, the last thing that needs to be done
  46. before passing it forward is to make sure all of the occurrences that
  47. have been stored in the datebase replace, in the list you are returning,
  48. the generated ones that are equivalent. This class makes this easier.
  50. """
  51. def __init__(self, persisted_occurrences):
  52. lookup = [
  53. ((occ.event, occ.original_start, occ.original_end), occ) for
  54. occ in persisted_occurrences]
  55. self.lookup = dict(lookup)
  57. def get_occurrence(self, occ):
  58. """
  59. Return a persisted occurrences matching the occ and remove it from
  60. lookup since it has already been matched
  61. """
  62. return self.lookup.pop(
  63. (occ.event, occ.original_start, occ.original_end),
  64. occ)
  66. def has_occurrence(self, occ):
  67. return (occ.event, occ.original_start, occ.original_end) in self.lookup
  69. def get_additional_occurrences(self, start, end):
  70. """
  71. Return persisted occurrences which are now in the period
  72. """
  73. return [occ for key, occ in self.lookup.items() if (
  74. (end and occ.start < end)
  75. and occ.end >= start and not occ.cancelled)]
